attributes.action: Give all small businesses affected by Coronavirus access to government grants.
attributes.additional_details: We’d like the government to either offer grants to all small businesses, even if they don’t have premises, or to give directors who receive a small salary and are paid mainly in dividends the same support as PAYE and self employed people (up to £2500 per month for 3 months). Many wonderful small businesses cannot afford to take out loans. We hope you will consider this.
attributes.background: Whist we appreciate the efforts the government has taken to compensate those affected by the Coronavirus, some are left without help. If you’re a small business owner who is paid a small salary and receives the rest of their income through dividends there is no help other than to take out a loan.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign these petitions calling for the same action:

Extend grants immediately to small businesses outside of SBRR: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/305024

Coronavirus Support Package for Directors / Shareholders of small Limited Co's: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/310515

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

Find out more and watch the Committee put questions suggested by petitioners to Government Ministers and the Deputy Chief Medical Officer: https://committees.parliament.uk/committee/326/petitions-committee/news/145767/committee-question-deputy-chief-medical-officer-and-ministers-on-coronavirus-response/
